Literature & Books.name: Fable & Verse: A Literary Primer
Literature & Books.description: Test your knowledge of classic tales and poetic forms with this introductory quiz. From Aesop's fables to Lewis Carroll's whimsical verse, see how well you know the foundations of literature.

questions.text: Which of these is not one of Aesop's fables?
Which of these words does not appear in the Lewis Carroll poem 'Jabberwocky'?
In the novel 'The Adventures of Tom Sawyer' what is the name of Tom's sweetheart?
If you are watching a Shavian play, who is the author?
Who wrote 'A Tale of Two Cities'?

Literature & Books.name: Echoes of the Page: Literary Adaptations
Literature & Books.description: Explore the intersection of literature and film with this quiz. Discover the stories behind beloved movies and test your knowledge of the authors who inspired them.

questions.text: The film 'Stand By Me' is based on a novel by what author?
What literary work is the source of the quote 'Abandon every hope, all you who enter here'?
In the novel 'Around the World in 80 Days' Phileas Fogg's faithful valet is named what?

Literature & Books.name: Beanstalks & Ballads: Folklore & Poetry
Literature & Books.description: Delve into the world of folklore and poetic expression with this quiz. From classic fairy tales to the innovative style of E.E. Cummings, see how much you know about these timeless forms.

questions.text: In the story 'Jack and the Beanstalk' what does Jack trade to get the magic beans?
What do the initials 'E. E.' in poet E. E. Cummings' name stand for?
Which of these Hemingway characters is a newspaperman?

Literature & Books.name: Literary Mashup: A Hodgepodge of Tales
Literature & Books.description: A whirlwind tour through classic literature! This quiz combines questions from various stories, poems, and authors to test your broad knowledge of the literary world.

questions.text: What children's storybook character believes that the sky is falling?
What Greek poet wrote 'The Iliad' and 'The Odyssey'?
